Package com.flag4j.linalg.decompositions

Class HessenburgDecomposition<T extends MatrixMixin<T,​T,​?,​?,​?,​U,​?>,​U extends VectorMixin<U,​U,​?,​?,​?,​T,​T,​?>>

java.lang.Object
com.flag4j.linalg.decompositions.HessenburgDecomposition<T,​U>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Decomposition<T>
Direct Known Subclasses:
ComplexHessenburgDecomposition, RealHessenburgDecomposition
public abstract class HessenburgDecomposition<T extends MatrixMixin<T,​T,​?,​?,​?,​U,​?>,​U extends VectorMixin<U,​U,​?,​?,​?,​T,​T,​?>> extends Object implements Decomposition<T>

This abstract class specifies methods for computing the Hessenburg decomposition of a square matrix. That is, for a square matrix A, computes the decomposition A=QHQ<sup>H</sup> where Q is a unitary matrix and H is a matrix in upper Hessenburg form which is similar to A (i.e. has the same eigenvalues/vectors).

A matrix H is in upper Hessenburg form if it is nearly upper triangular. Specifically, if H has all zeros below the first sub-diagonal.

For example, the following matrix is in upper Hessenburg form where each x may hold a different value: 

     [[ x x x x x ]
      [ x x x x x ]
      [ 0 x x x x ]
      [ 0 0 x x x ]
      [ 0 0 0 x x ]]

  • Constructor Details

    • HessenburgDecomposition

      protected HessenburgDecomposition​(boolean computeQ)
      Constructs a Hessenburg decomposer which specifies if the unitary matrix Q in the decomposition should be computed.
      Parameters:
      computeQ - Flag for determining if the Q in the decomposition should be computed.
      - If true, the unitary Q matrix will be computed.
      - If false, the unitary Q matrix will not be computed which may give a performance increase if it is not needed.

  • Method Details

    • decompose

      public HessenburgDecomposition<T,​U> decompose​(T src)
      Hessenburg decomposition of a square matrix. That is, for a square matrix A, computes the decomposition A=QHQ<sup>T</sup> where Q is a unitary matrix and H is a matrix in upper Hessenburg form which is similar to A (i.e. has the same eigenvalues/vectors).

      Specified by:
      decompose in interface Decomposition<T extends MatrixMixin<T,​T,​?,​?,​?,​U,​?>>
      Parameters:
      src - The source matrix to decompose.
      Returns:
      A reference to this decomposer.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the src matrix is not square.
